H0.text: Which English public school shares it's name with a farm implement. Plough

H1.text: Which English public school shares it's name with a farm implement. Rake

H2.text: Which English public school shares it's name with a farm implement. Sickle

H3.text: Which English public school shares it's name with a farm implement. Harrow

A4.text: Harrow School was founded in 1572 by John Lyon, a local landowner and farmer.

A5.text: Harrow School () is a public school (English boarding school for boys) in Harrow on the Hill, Greater London, England.
